intro: Oxydectes agoensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit and produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant has fleshy, thick leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a popular houseplant due to its ornamental value. Oxydectes agoensis prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
